derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb in the sense 'send back again'): from late Latin remandare, from re- 'back' + mandare 'commit'. The noun dates from the late 18th cent

entry.tran: 将…还押候审;使取保候审
entry.def: If a person who is accused of a crime is remanded in custody or on bail, they are told to return to the court at a later date, when their trial will take place.

example.ex: Carter was remanded in custody for seven days...
Both were remanded on bail by Wrexham magistrates until March 24.
example.tran: 两个人都被雷克瑟姆的地方治安官批准保释，直到3月24日审判。

entry.tran: 还押候审（期）；取保候审（期）
entry.def: Remand is used to refer to the process of remanding someone in custody or on bail, or to the period of time until their trial begins.

example.ex: The remand hearing is often over in three minutes...
example.tran: 取保候审听证会通常在3分钟内结束。

example.ex: This will mean more remand prisoners being held in police cells...
example.tran: 这将意味着更多候审犯人会被拘押在警局拘留室。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of sending an accused person back into custody to await trial (or the continuation of the trial)
1. refer (a matter or legal case) to another committe or authority or court for decision
2. lock up or confine, in or as in a jail;

sentences.sentence: "the murderer was incarcerated for the rest of his life"

auth_sentence.content: Martin spent five months on remand while waiting to be sentenced for the harassment.
auth_sentence.res_content: Martin spent five months on remand while waiting to be sentenced for the harassment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Martin spent five months on remand while waiting to be sentenced for the harassment.

auth_sentence.content: He was sentenced at West London Magistrates' Court but walked free because of time he spent on remand.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was sentenced at West London Magistrates' Court but walked free because of time he spent on remand.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was sentenced at West London Magistrates' Court but walked free because of time he spent on remand.

auth_sentence.content: Some stories, he said, led to people being arrested and locked up on remand, before the case against them collapsed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some stories, he said, led to people being arrested and locked up on remand, before the case against them collapsed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some stories, he said, led to people being arrested and locked up on remand, before the case against them collapsed.

sentences.en: He spent a week in custody on remand awaiting sentence.
sentences.cn: 等候判决期间他被还押候审一个星期。

sentences.en: He was held on remand, charged with causing malicious damage to property.
sentences.cn: 他因恶意破坏财产而被关押候审。

sentences.en: A man has been remanded in custody charged with the murder of an eight-year-old girl.
sentences.cn: 一名男子被指控谋杀了一名 8岁的女孩，现已还押候审。
